summary: User asks how to inject configuration into workflow constructors, as workflows must be instantiated without arguments. Discussion reveals workflows must be deterministic and suggests using signals, activities, or side-effects for dependency injection.
userImpact: Developers need guidance on how to pass configuration to workflows while maintaining determinism, a common pattern in legacy system migrations.
rootCause: Workflows require deterministic instantiation without constructor arguments to maintain replay consistency, creating tension with common DI patterns.
proposedFix: Use signals, activities, or local activities to pass configuration data into workflows deterministically, with local activities being the preferred long-term solution.
workaround: Load configuration via activity calls within the workflow, or use startWithSignal to inject config at workflow start time, or use side-effects for file-based config.
resolutionDetails: User resolved their own confusion by understanding Temporal's determinism requirements and implementing configuration loading via activities.
keyQuote: Local Activities are planned in the 1.1 version of this SDK... workflow fully controls its config and does not expose anything to the outside.
